intro: Pavetta pleiantha, commonly known as the white pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when mature.
